tiber_player_evaluation_proposal.philosophy: Move beyond rigid rankings to flexible, context-aware player evaluation
problems_with_traditional_rankings: Single number can't capture player complexity
Doesn't account for league format differences
Creates false precision where uncertainty exists
Doesn't help with actual decision-making scenarios

tier_classification.description: Broad talent groupings instead of specific ranks
tier_classification.flexibility: Players can move between adjacent tiers based on context

scenario_scores.description: How player performs in different contexts

data_sources_needed: Age curve data for each position

evaluation_process.step_5: Generate tier placement and context tags

example_player_profile.name: Ja'Marr Chase
key_insights: Target competition minimal with Higgins departure
Elite talent with secure usage profile

advantages_over_rankings: Provides decision-making context instead of just ordering
Adapts to different league formats and strategies
Helps users understand WHY a player has value
Supports both win-now and rebuild strategies

evaluation_criteria: What specific metrics matter most for each position?
How should age curves be applied differently by position?
What constitutes 'usage security' vs 'target competition risk'?
How do you weight talent vs situation vs opportunity?
philosophical_alignment: What alternative to 'rankings' are you envisioning?
How flexible should tier boundaries be?
What decision-making scenarios should the system prioritize?
How do you want to handle uncertainty and projection ranges?
data_validation: Which current player evaluations represent your methodology?
What players would you use as tier boundary examples?
How should the system handle controversial or difficult cases?
What edge cases or exceptions need special handling?
